body:
The problem is they've gone from reacting to the "hate all white people" nonsense with "all lives matter" to "white people are better than black people, get white birth rates up and stop other races from having kids!". And "men are not devils" to "society collapsed when women were given any rights at all!". And I've even seen attacks on free speech if it doesn't advocate for traditionalism. This is not the American movement founded by the anti-federalists which later descended into the Republican Party we knew for so long, it is like being a Tory during the Revolution. I understand the fear and why everything feels justified during chaos, but the fear is of tyranny and they want to stop it, yet their new solution is creating their own system of tyranny? How can Satan drive out Satan? That's not going to fix a damn thing, it just makes it worse because now both parties are just as bad as the other and there's not even a lesser of the two evils anymore. If you want to make a change and oppose someone else you obviously don't go and do the exact same things they're doing, yet "conservatives" right now don't seem to understand this and they've completely abandoned everything they once stood for.

On a more minor note, I must add that Donald Trump is not a conservative, but a populist. His campaign is targeted at the interests of the people, not party principles. However it's interesting that you bring him up, because he actually proves my point. Prior to his election many conservatives feared he might be too authoritarian and untrustworthy. Now however, they're complaining that he's not anywhere near authoritarian *enough* for them, despite his auth tendencies increasing over the course of his first term. Trump hasn't been affected much by this new movement, and he shows how the same people now view him from the opposite side of the pole.

These people have been completely backed into a corner, the radicalization you see isn't a coincidence. It's a complete reaction to authoritarian leftist woke cult tyrants who yes, do want to destroy their traditions, freedoms, and values and force all sorts of horrible shit on everyone. They are completely open about that. When you play hardcore identity politics for decades and divide the populace where everyone else is "allowed" to consolidate power through ethnic groups....except white people, then it should come as absolutely no surprise that a certain % of white people feel like they are under attack. When street thugs destroy small businesses and terrorize cities and neighborhoods for months, with zero consequences, with politicians and massive corporations essentially sponsoring their chaos, and corrupt DAs releasing them and special interest groups bailing them out, and YOU'RE RACIST if you aren't supporting them, conservatives feel like they are under attack.

And based on the blatant ramping up of MSM propaganda, critical race theory communist bullshit infiltrating and ruining every institution (academia, video games, movies, books, sports, !SCIENCE!, our military, etc) and technocrat censorship of anyone questioning any of these compromised institutions, they aren't wrong.  I've been saying since Trayvon Martin that all of this race nonsense is just a way to fire up the peasants against each other so they don't focus on the ruling class robbing us blind. They've put it on maximum overdrive, with a new "Fuck You America, We Spit In Your Face ("COVID Relief") Bill" every few months. 

It's sad to see, but I still refuse to believe that the majority of conservatives are now rabid ethnonationalists and racists. They are just fucking pissed off and completely awake to blatantly hostile forces attacking them from every angle with no respite, and no recourse. Everything has accelerated, expect massive attacks on the 2nd amendment to come soon - they're already brewing. The GOP is completely cucked and sold out to the same special interests and oligarchs that run everything, and there is no representation for the average "conservative" aside from Donald Trump and a few blowhard women in Congress. Everyone else is compromised and voting really doesn't mean anything anymore. At this point I don't even think of it as left vs. right, liberal vs. conservative whatever.  It's are you down with the global authoritarian woke cult? Massive government control in your life, censorship, critical race theory, America is and has always been a fundamentally racist country, gender and trans kids salad, silence is violence. Or do you reject this atrocity of ideology and seek sovereignty and freedom?  This ideology is societal weaponized AIDS and it's doing a damn good job completely destroying our civilization and making everyone hate each other for stupid fucking reasons. The constant assault coming from the left and the elites certainly will create more racists and radical ethnonationalists.

Our country is on the verge of death if it isn't dead already, and honestly the best thing that could happen is likely secession or a Balkanization of sorts before we all start killing each other. I don't think the corporate socialist technocrat tyrant overlords want any of their potential slaves to get away with anything like that though.

body:
> The entire root of feminism was never about "treating women like actual people" because women have overwhelmingly been treated as "actual people"

This is correct for right now, in fact women are overly spoiled at the moment. Unfortunately this is the result of primal instincts as the female body is more inherently valuable and scare for reproduction, and nature revolves around reproduction, so it will be pretty much impossible to stop. But historically the men have been jealous of this and oppressed them for revenge, sometimes to the point of literally treating them like property.

> more by believers in Christ than any other people since the beginning of time.

This is correct. However you do not seem to be doing so.

> The root of feminism has always been about breaking down the God created structure between man and woman and started with the serpent telling Eve she could be like God.

The root of the initial waves of feminism was recognizing that envy isn't a valid reason to get revenge on someone, especially if they are not at fault for it (and no one chooses which chromosomes they're born with). Your argument assumes that every woman is identical to Eve, and even if that were true what this basically boils down to is "yeah I did it too but *she started it*!", hardly a valid excuse. If you want to read that much into a creation story which was undoubtedly exaggerated and expanded on over time before being written down, you should consider that it took a devil to deceive the woman but Adam just blindly ate the apple when Eve told him to. I can play this game too. That account has absolutely nothing to do with which chromosome is "more evil" than the other. The only thing it mentions is that men would mostly overpower women as one of the punishments, along arguably even worse consequences for the man.

> Your not even a christian

Yes, I am, and I'm concerned that you don't recognize the good news.

body:
Why am I not surprised? "Porn is okay but treating women like human beings is the worst sin you can commit!". Look, I agree that we go way too far with what we call "lust" these days. But porn is still an evil industry for many of the same reasons as prostitution and you shouldn't support it. And you're basically setting up a double standard where it's okay for *you* to do these things simply because you're a male, but not women. Sorry, but having balls does not make you justify everything you do.

> The church helps push young men into porn use by encouraging young women not to pursue marriage and family but to pursue other interests first, with marriage being a "well, someday"

Read 1 Corinthians 7. And guess who else wasn't married? **Jesus**. And you know what he said too? Check out Matthew 19. Checkmate. Turn around and come back to the good news, I welcome you and I'm not alone.

> Conservative christians hold womens rights up as a sacred cow just like liberals do, just in a different way. In both cases the wool has been pulled over their eyes by satan, who is more than happy to disrupt the God created order.

Ah yes, women being more than pieces of meat for males' sexual pleasure and having babies is satan's order. I suppose that makes every good character in the Bible a satanist then. What a shame, that was such a good book. And not that these "conservative christians" you mention even support equal rights in the first place, they just at least pretend to.

body:
> Like right off the top, the part about how we're flawed but should be forgiven if we really try not to fuck up, that's good and all, but Christianity - as represented by lots of actual Christians I've encountered, I'm not interested in debating some imaginary version of Christianity where this doesn't happen - takes it crazily far and goes like "you are WORTHLESS and NOTHING and you're SCUM and you SUCK, but Jesus loves you anyway even though you're a fucking piece of SHIT, you're GARBAGE, you're FUCKING TRASH, Jesus is PERFECT, he's fucking GOD you piece of SHIT and he's willing to condescend to love something as SHIT as you, FUCK YOU thank him for loving you."

It's uncomfortable but true. Most people are just good at trying to ignore it. But when you crack it's your only refuge. No one ever said this world was good.

> And, you know, fuck that. I'm a human being, I like myself, I'm not signing up for any club that wants to grind my face in how much I supposedly fucking suck before I'm allowed to be "saved".

That sounds more like bullying. It's supposed to be a personal thing, not something to taunt people with.

> I don't need a religion that tells me I'm perfect and kissing my ass, you know, like the one the jews have for themselves

body: I agree that most "Christians" hate Jesus's commands and worship the disciples above him, especially Paul, but I disagree that Paul was the antichrist. There is indeed a lot of heretical content in "Paul's letters" but it's also in Peter's, Jude's, James's, and really all of them. What I've slowly realized is that all of those questionable passages are exactly the ones that show signs of being later additions by scribes in the second century. There is significant evidence that the catholic church fathers edited the new testament extensively in the epistles, most of which are complete forgeries, the others being composites of multiple letters thrown together with no regard for order and tons of added sections by the editors, and that they destroyed all copies deviating from their texts. If you read the authentic letters of Paul, and realize that much of it is interpolations, the original lines up with Jesus pretty much exactly. I suspect that most of these texts are about 50% longer than the originals, maybe even more so. Even more evidence: when Marcion (a gnostic heretic, but still relevant here) broke from the church, he noticed that the church was continuously adding to the version he had initially received. Already in less than a century, the church's official Pauline texts had grown to be 30% longer than his, and even his version had plenty of additions from before he received them. And they had made up all kinds of new fake letters for the disciples too. Some say this is because Marcion expunged the parts he didn't like, but the textual evidence says otherwise, and Marcion's versions contained plenty of passages contradicting his own theology, which he'd of course have removed had he actually done so. All the evidence shows that "the church" was less faithful to the text than a gnostic.

parent.body:
Go to a church.
If the minister uses the Bible as a prop, and rarely reads from it, never go back.
If the minister says things like "I think," a lot, go somewhere else. If he often says "The Bible tells us," and then proceeds to read from it, it may be a good place to stay a while.
If the minister never (or rarely) puts things in context by explaining the culture of the time and place his references were written, then look for a better place. It may be possible to suggest this to him, and he may listen.
If he jumps around a lot and won't focus on one course of study over a few weeks, it is probably best to go elsewhere. And above all, if the minister even HINTS that we should go along to get along in order to spread the word to as many as possible, run fast and run far. Those are some of the first things I look for in a new church.

post.body:
Like right off the top, the part about how we're flawed but should be forgiven if we really try not to fuck up, that's good and all, but Christianity - as represented by lots of actual Christians I've encountered, I'm not interested in debating some imaginary version of Christianity where this doesn't happen - takes it crazily far and goes like "you are WORTHLESS and NOTHING and you're SCUM and you SUCK, but Jesus loves you anyway even though you're a fucking piece of SHIT, you're GARBAGE, you're FUCKING TRASH, Jesus is PERFECT, he's fucking GOD you piece of SHIT and he's willing to condescend to love something as SHIT as you, FUCK YOU thank him for loving you."

And, you know, fuck that. I'm a human being, I like myself, I'm not signing up for any club that wants to grind my face in how much I supposedly fucking suck before I'm allowed to be "saved". 

I don't need a religion that tells me I'm perfect and kissing my ass, you know, like the one the jews have for themselves. But I do want one that's like, you know "Hey bro, you're okay, God likes you because you're an all right dude actually, thumbs up, but you know, your shit still stinks bro, so remember to keep your ass clean."

And then there's some of the specific moral advice that's really stupid that people even mostly kind of recognize is really stupid, in particular

- the part about letting people who hit you once hit you again

- the part about how if you ever look at a woman and think "damn I'd fuck her" you're a sinner who's going to burn in hell

Everyone gives you some completely different line of shit about how they don't mean what they obviously mean because of some translation of a translation of a translation but at that point I lose my suspension of disbelief in the religion I've never been able to buy that God's mysterious plan involves throwing people into hell and/or giving them miserable shitty lives on Earth because they didn't think to ask what about the technical points of what things mean in hebrew.

Those are more or less the things that keep me from buying in on Christianity. There are a few other things I think are bullshit but IIRC they mostly came from the stuff that like the disciples and apostles and whoever said after his death, so if I was sold on the stuff he did say I could tell myself "well fuck it that other shit was just his disciples, I know what Jesus really meant."

>I've written a half dozen blog posts on how modern Western christians have zero understanding of the sin called "lust", and that, no, even looking at another mans wife and thinking "Damn, I'd fuck her" doesn't equate to sin. Its a common misconception that has been formed mostly because of Western feminism and weak men. Rest assured, however, that checking out that hot redhead sitting across the restaurant and imagining what she would look like buck naked and tied down to a table does not meet the definition of being "lust".

Sorry that's total bullshit, that's everyone's definition of lust, you don't get to pretend lust means some random thing that you also don't bother to define instead of what everyone already knows it means after you put the word "lust" in the bible specifically with the words "anyone who feels lust is going to hell, straight up, no joke"

Like I said it really seems like the son of god wants to throw a lot of people into hell based on technicalities and not knowing random-ass obscure translations. Nobody should HAVE to know whatever random obscuritan nonsense it is that's enabling you to commit the sin of pride because you know whatever Jesus supposedly meant according to some definition that nobody anywhere uses.

>one thing does that and we have to voluntarily take that step. 

But it's not really one step is it, it's a never-ending number of steps after which you're still never free of sin and always having to beg forgiveness because nobody told you that lust doesn't actually mean what everyone you've ever known has said it means and also acted like it means.

>One of the last things Jesus told the disciples before he left them was to buy a sword, and if they didn't have enough money for one, to literally sell their coat to get one. 

I looked this up and he literally has them buy two swords, then tells them not to buy any more swords, lmao.

body:
> that doesn't make erotica bad

It's the objectification of women (or men) that's bad. I don't think you can be blamed for impulses but watching real videos of real people being sexualized isn't much different than prostitution.

> you aren't even a christian

You keep saying that even though I am.

> Your insistence that I read scripture and your quotes of scripture are humorous and silly! It would be like me thinking I could tell a brain surgeon how to perform a surgery simply because I've read a bunch of books and know the history of the medical profession. Sure I might know a lot, but the meat of knowledge, the know how, the understanding would not be there.

So you're basically just going to ignore it because you don't like that it doesn't align with your selfish values. I agree the bible isn't always accurate but this teaching fits with the overall God-given principle. You seem to be motivated more by a desire that everyone should be exactly like you.

> You lack the Holy spirit and by the things you post I can see you detest him! The questions you post and your comments are the words of one who knows God is real but hates Him, so time is spent trying to convince others to hate Him as well.

I never denied God was real nor do I detest him. What I detest is people doing evil in God's name. People using "God" as an excuse to demand special treatment for themselves while mistreating others. Do you know who the Pharisees and Sadducees were?

> Loaded with tons of "gotcha" catch phrases and little bits of scripture, its cute.

That's what *you* do with your "proof texts" to support your crazy doctrines such as women should be nothing but pieces of meat at mens' disposal. I can't speak for you but in my experience people saying those things do that, quote little bits from Paul's letters (most of which aren't even really his) and a few other pieces and twist it any way they want to. And rarely ever giving the gospels, the literal words of Jesus, any attention.

> without the imbuing of the Holy spirit you will never grasp an understanding of scripture, and you should be summarily ignored.

In contrast, I understand it much better than I used to, when I was like you, when I fell for all these lies of TV preachers and political theology. The Holy Spirit taught me far more clearly. Things are starting to make sense now.

Your insistence that I read scripture and your quotes of scripture are humorous and silly! It would be like me thinking I could tell a brain surgeon how to perform a surgery simply because I've read a bunch of books and know the history of the medical profession. Sure I might know a lot, but the meat of knowledge, the know how, the understanding would not be there.

So you're basically just going to ignore it because you don't like that it doesn't align with your selfish values. I agree the bible isn't always accurate but this teaching fits with the overall God-given principle. You seem to be motivated more by a desire that everyone should be exactly like you.

You lack the Holy spirit and by the things you post I can see you detest him! The questions you post and your comments are the words of one who knows God is real but hates Him, so time is spent trying to convince others to hate Him as well.

I never denied God was real nor do I detest him. What I detest is people doing evil in God's name. People using "God" as an excuse to demand special treatment for themselves while mistreating others. Do you know who the Pharisees and Sadducees were?

Loaded with tons of "gotcha" catch phrases and little bits of scripture, its cute.

That's what you do with your "proof texts" to support your crazy doctrines such as women should be nothing but pieces of meat at mens' disposal. I can't speak for you but in my experience people saying those things do that, quote little bits from Paul's letters (most of which aren't even really his) and a few other pieces and twist it any way they want to. And rarely ever giving the gospels, the literal words of Jesus, any attention.

without the imbuing of the Holy spirit you will never grasp an understanding of scripture, and you should be summarily ignored.

In contrast, I understand it much better than I used to, when I was like you, when I fell for all these lies of TV preachers and political theology. The Holy Spirit taught me far more clearly. Things are starting to make sense now.

parent.body:
Of course you're not surprised, friend. You claim to have knowledge, which is questionable at best, I mean, after all we are all sitting at some kind of connected device and can find and repeat tons of information on anything we want, but you lack wisdom.

The porn industry is horrendous, that doesn't make erotica bad. Starbucks is a garbage company that does more harm than good, are we supposed to condemn all coffee beans?

Your questions and responses are juvenile at best and would sound fine coming out of the mouth of a young believer eager to learn, but you aren't even a christian, so they just come off as sophomoric and dumb. Your insistence that I read scripture and your quotes of scripture are humorous and silly! It would be like me thinking I could tell a brain surgeon how to perform a surgery simply because I've read a bunch of books and know the history of the medical profession. Sure I might know a lot, but the meat of knowledge, the know how, the understanding would not be there. You lack the Holy spirit and by the things you post I can see you detest him! The questions you post and your comments are the words of one who knows God is real but hates Him, so time is spent trying to convince others to hate Him as well. So you don't want to be a christian, why spend the time and effort harassing others who do? Your like so many other atheists out there, so smart, right? Loaded with tons of "gotcha" catch phrases and little bits of scripture, its cute. Again, better men (or women) than you have already done what you are doing and it hasn't killed christianity, but I guess in the year of our Lord 2021 a lot of people have a lot of time on their hands.

Do something constructive with your time because harassing people for the sake of harassing people is a sign of some kind of mental deficiency or psychotic obsession. All you are doing is making yourself look a fool and discussing things you know about but can't possibly understand. Yes, yes, I know: You are soooooo learned and you could run rings around me with your vast knowledge of, well, whatever you say you have vast knowledge of, and that's fine, but without the imbuing of the Holy spirit you will never grasp an understanding of scripture, and you should be summarily ignored.
